column3: The average annual mileage of a household car was 7900 miles in 2014

column2: And while over the long term the number of adults with driving licences has increased
Car availability also has a major influence on personal travel patterns
People in households with cars on average make more trips and travel much further than those without cars
NEW report show how motorists wait before dealing with problems
Over a half of British motorists wait more than three months to get their cars checked after problems with them emerge
Some of the headline figures include
The problem that drivers most commonly ignore is an illuminated engine management light
The second most commonly neglected problem is a worn wheel bearing
